result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason T Clark was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Must continue all AODA programming currently pariticipating in.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  You shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person with the victim, K.C. until your agent deems appropriate.

Must participate in and successfully complete Jackson County DV Court if your probation agent deems appropriate.  

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Must pay the DNA surcharge but a sample is already on file.

Defendant appears in custody with counsel SPD Carly Sebion.  ADA Inlow appears for the State.  State has complied with victim notification requirements in both cases - no response in either case.  15CM233 - Defendant enters a no contest plea.  Judge reviews charges/penalties/elements/rights.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to charge he is pleading to.  Court finds defendant understands, FVI makes plea, waives rights voluntarily, factual basis exists; finding of guilty.   There is a joint recommendation on 15CM233  of 1 year probation with conditions.

14CM297 - sentencing after revocation - has 65 days sentence credit.  Defense counsel speaks.  Defendant speaks.  Judge sentences to time served.  Judgement for court financial obligations.  15CM233 - Court accepts joint recommendation and withholds sentence and places on 1 year probation with conditions:    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Defendant must execute all releases of information for assessments, counseling, treatment, to allow probation agent to verify compliance.  Must participate in and successfully complete Jackson County DV Court only if probation agent deems appropriate.  Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.   No contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person with the victim, K.C. until your probation agent deems appropriate.  Must continue with all AODA programming currently participating in.  Must follow any other recommendations of your agent.  Must pay the costs of the action including the DNA surcharge.  No DNA sample needed as one is already on file.

Pre-trial conference at 10-21-2015 10:00 am.
Status conference at 11-09-2015 03:00 pm.

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the jail.  Attorney Sebion appeared in court.  Adj. to 1:00 today.  Resumed at 1:21 pm.  Attorney Sebion appeared specially.  Waive reading of complaint.  NGP entered.  PTC 10/21  & STC 11/9/15 at 3 pm.  Bond continued.

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.   As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses:  K. C., the victim.

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the jail.  Court recited the charge and possible penalties.  Defendant understood. AIA set for 9/28/15 at 9:30 am.  Contact SPD.  Other options for representation explained.
